Live blog: Bruins, Blackhawks tied after first period

Rich Peverly fired a shot into the upper right of the Blackhawks' net to even the game in the first period after Chicago scored first on a short-handed goal. We have updates from TD Garden.

Pictures: Scenes from tonight's Game 4

(Charles Krupa/AP)
Bruins center Rich Peverley (right) celebrated his goal in front of Blackhawks goalie Corey Crawford during the first period in Game 4.

Business & Money

Dunkin’ Donuts to offer gluten-free donuts, muffins

Americans who want to be gluten-free now will have another option: Dunkin’ Donuts announced Wednesday it will begin offering gluten-free doughnuts and muffins in all its U.S. locations this year.

Mass. home building slump

Despite a rise across the US, construction of new, single-family homes here has fallen to anemic levels not seen in decades, with no signs of a major uptick in the horizon.
